Ha!  Here's a trick my friend and I used to pull when we were new
to Gladiator and playing with the shareware version.

We'd go to the slime level (the first one) and fence off  breeding
areas with a druid (usually we only had two players, and one of us
was the druid -- if you have more controlled by the computer, they
get dumb).  The slimes would multiply and give us something to kill,
though it was a slow process.  This is more reminiscence for me
than a real tip for people.

What else?  Sending numerous sprites after a difficult enemy, then
pulling a cleric through to sweep the blood spots up and make
some undead.  This is a druid and cleric thing, and my favorite
class is thief, so it doesn't happen often.

There's always the "leaving their bases intact to produce more
enemies..." but if the level is difficult enough for you to make any
major gain off this it might be necessary to go for the bases early
on, before you overwhelm yourself.  Flying potions are another
way to injure yourself (walk on water), and thieves can really
screw themselves up with their own explosives. :)

-Chris/Shayd
